CS has been and always will be one of the best competitive shooters ever to be made. As an esport all the way down to the casual player it is an amazing experience.
A hive of scum and villany, a cesspool of degenerates and doddering russians.
Pior jogo que j√° joguei na minha vida, mas todo dia jogo, recomendo para pessoas que n√£o querem stress para sua vida, pessoas que procuram a paz interior. Recomendo.

If you play against someone who's hacking and you abandon the match, you get banned. You can't surrender the match until someone on your team abandons.

 If you find that someone is hacking or trolling on your team in a couple of games in a row and you kick them each time, you get banned for too many team-kicks.

 If it turns out that you had a hacker in your game and they then get VAC banned, the match doesn't count so it was a hour-long waste of time making you finish it.

 The game punishes you for their failures in designing a competent anti-cheat by preventing you from leaving, surrendering or kicking players that use exploits. 

 It's great at the core but for a game that is the focus of the e-sports and competitive game world it's a joke that this is a problem. I can't recommend a game that has a clear anti-player mentality.
